lines.text: Blood is like chewing gum to these creatures!
[Dr. Van Helsing is translating for Edgar]
Her powers are fading; there's only so much she can do here and now.
She's lost a lot of blood.
Replenishing it means going back to her native soil.
Her native soil is soaked with blood.
She's on her way back now.

Some women understand extremes. They understand how to push things to extremes. Life and death. The moon, tide, eternal flow... women understand that kind of stuff. It's in their blood. Once a month, their bodies let them know that... nature's one continuous disaster.
It's hard to read a medical book without feeling disgust for the whole human race. Our bodies are so complicated and ugly.
Face it, Jim. She's a zombie.
Life is full of pain. But I am not afraid. The pain I feel is the pain of fleeting joy.

[putting on dark glasses]
What do you see?
In the glasses, in the glasses, what do you see?
Good. Good, yes, okay. This means she's still with us. She's an apprentice in the realm of shadows. There's hope. But you mustn't flinch from what we have to do.
As you get older, you begin to realise that family is all that really matters.
My father was a night bird. I am the same. I find comfort in shadows. I'm no good in the day. We have an allergy to sunlight. My whole family.
